title: Percentage Calculator
description: Calculate percentages quickly and easily. Find what percent one number is of another, calculate percentage increase/decrease, percentage change, and percentage difference between two values.

meta.title: Percentage Calculator - Free Online Percent Calculator
meta.description: Free online percentage calculator. Calculate what percent one number is of another, find percentage increase or decrease, percentage change, and solve percentage problems instantly.
meta.keywords: percentage calculator, percent calculator, percentage change, percentage difference, what is percent of, calculate percentage, online percentage calculator

whatIsPercentOf.label: X% of Y
whatIsPercentOf.description: Calculate what a certain percentage of a number is. For example, what is 25% of 200?

isWhatPercentOf.label: X is what % of Y
isWhatPercentOf.description: Find what percentage one number is of another. For example, 50 is what percent of 200?

isPercentOfWhat.label: X is Y% of what
isPercentOfWhat.description: Find the original number when you know the result and percentage. For example, 50 is 25% of what?

percentChange.label: % Change
percentChange.description: Calculate the percentage change from one value to another. Shows if it's an increase or decrease.

percentDifference.label: % Difference
percentDifference.description: Calculate the percentage difference between two values, using their average as the reference point.

disclaimer.text: This calculator provides mathematical calculations for educational and informational purposes. Always verify important calculations.
disclaimer.note: Results are rounded for display but calculations use full precision.

seo.whatIsContent: A percentage calculator is a mathematical tool that helps you solve various percentage-related problems quickly and accurately. Percentages are used extensively in everyday life—from calculating discounts and tips to understanding financial growth, test scores, and statistical data. Our calculator supports five different calculation modes to handle any percentage problem you might encounter.
seo.modesIntro: Our percentage calculator offers five powerful calculation modes:
seo.mode1: What is X% of Y? – Find a percentage of any number (e.g., 20% of 150 = 30)
seo.mode2: X is what % of Y? – Determine what percentage one number is of another (e.g., 30 is 20% of 150)
seo.mode3: X is Y% of what? – Find the original number from a percentage result (e.g., 30 is 20% of 150)
seo.mode4: Percentage Change – Calculate increase or decrease between two values (e.g., 100 to 125 = 25% increase)
seo.mode5: Percentage Difference – Find the relative difference between two values using their average as base
seo.benefit1: Instant results – Get accurate answers immediately without manual calculations
seo.benefit2: Multiple modes – Solve any type of percentage problem with one tool
seo.benefit3: Step-by-step formulas – See the exact calculation method used
seo.benefit4: Error prevention – Avoid common mistakes in percentage calculations
seo.benefit5: Free and unlimited – Use as many times as you need at no cost
seo.howToUseTitle: How to Use the Percentage Calculator
seo.howToUseStep1: Select the calculation mode that matches your problem
seo.howToUseStep2: Enter your known values in the input fields
seo.howToUseStep4: Check the formula and explanation for understanding
seo.howToUseStep5: Use the Reset button to start a new calculation
seo.tip1: Remember that 'of' in math usually means multiplication
seo.tip2: Percentage change can be negative (decrease) or positive (increase)
seo.tip3: Percentage difference is always positive since it measures absolute difference
seo.tip4: To convert a decimal to percentage, multiply by 100
seo.tip5: To convert a percentage to decimal, divide by 100
seo.faq1Question: How do I calculate a percentage of a number?
seo.faq1Answer: To find X% of Y, multiply Y by X and divide by 100. For example, 20% of 150 = (150 × 20) ÷ 100 = 30. This is like finding a fraction of the whole number.
seo.faq2Question: What's the difference between percentage change and percentage difference?
seo.faq2Answer: Percentage change measures the relative change from one specific value to another (has direction: increase or decrease). Percentage difference measures how different two values are compared to their average (no direction, always positive).
seo.faq3Question: How do I calculate percentage increase?
seo.faq3Answer: Subtract the original value from the new value, divide by the original value, and multiply by 100. If the result is positive, it's an increase. Formula: ((New - Old) ÷ Old) × 100.
seo.faq4Question: How do I calculate percentage decrease?
seo.faq4Answer: Use the same formula as percentage increase. If the result is negative, it's a decrease. The absolute value tells you the percentage of decrease. For example, going from 100 to 80 is a 20% decrease.
seo.faq5Answer: Yes! A percentage greater than 100% means the result is larger than the original reference value. For example, 200% of 50 is 100, which is double the original number.
seo.faq6Answer: The word 'percent' comes from Latin 'per centum' meaning 'by the hundred.' A percentage is simply a number expressed as a fraction of 100. So 25% means 25 out of 100, or 25/100 = 0.25.
seo.faq7Question: How do I convert between fractions, decimals, and percentages?
seo.faq7Answer: To convert a fraction to percentage: divide and multiply by 100 (1/4 = 0.25 × 100 = 25%). To convert decimal to percentage: multiply by 100 (0.75 × 100 = 75%). To convert percentage to decimal: divide by 100 (60% ÷ 100 = 0.6).
seo.faq8Question: Why is percentage difference calculated using the average?
seo.faq8Answer: Percentage difference uses the average of two values as the reference point because neither value is considered the 'starting' point. This makes it symmetric—the percentage difference between A and B is the same as between B and A.
